classData.comment:
/**
 * Creates a nested Proxy that represents a level in the hierarchical data structure.
 * @param {Neo.state.Provider} rootProvider The top-level provider to start searches from.
 * @param {String} path The current path of this proxy level (e.g., 'user' for data.user).
 * @returns {Proxy|null}
 * @private
 */
classData.description: Creates a nested Proxy that represents a level in the hierarchical data structure.

params.description: The top-level provider to start searches from.
params.name: rootProvider

params.description: The current path of this proxy level (e.g., 'user' for data.user).
params.name: path

classData.name: createNestedProxy

classData.comment:
/**
         * The get trap for the proxy. This is where the magic happens.
         * @param {Object} currentTarget The proxy's target object.
         * @param {String|Symbol} property The name of the property being accessed.
         * @returns {*} The value of the property or a new proxy for nested access.
         */
classData.description: The get trap for the proxy. This is where the magic happens.

params.description: The name of the property being accessed.
params.name: property

returns.description: The value of the property or a new proxy for nested access.

classData.name: get

classData.comment:
/**
 * Creates a Proxy object that represents the merged, hierarchical data from a `state.Provider` chain.
 * When a property is accessed through this proxy while an Effect is running, it automatically
 * tracks the underlying core.Config instance as a dependency.
 * @param {Neo.state.Provider} provider The starting state.Provider.
 * @returns {Proxy}
 */
classData.description: Creates a Proxy object that represents the merged, hierarchical data from a state.Provider chain. When a property is accessed through this proxy while an Effect is running, it automatically tracks the underlying core.Config instance as a dependency.
classData.name: createHierarchicalDataProxy
